alert.note: Alert for Latah; Lewis; Nez Perce (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Air Quality Alert issued September 15 at 3:50PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...AIR QUALITY ADVISORY FROM THE IDAHO DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY... * WHAT...Air Quality Advisory because of degraded air quality due to wildfire smoke. Air Quality Index is forecast to be Unhealthy. * WHERE...Latah, Lewis and Nez Perce counties off the Nez Perce Reservation. * WHEN...Until 11 AM on Friday, September 16th. * IMPACTS...Some members of the general public may experience health effects. Members of sensitive groups may experience more serious health effects. PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... Air pollutants can cause difficulties for children, the elderly, as well as persons with respiratory problems. Those individuals who are sensitive to increased particulate matter or smoke are encouraged to avoid prolonged or strenuous outdoor activity during this advisory. Open burning is prohibited by air quality rule. it is also recommended that all other individuals limit prolonged or strenuous activity outdoors. For more information, contact Nez Perce Tribe ERWM Air Quality at 1-800-720-4089 or Lewiston Regional Office at (208) 799-4370.
